posts.name: Pickle
posts.cooked:
Screen sharing is a really nice feature, and I‚Äôm really glad Signal has it. Signal‚Äôs screen sharing is just almost good enough to where I don‚Äôt need to use other platforms for screen sharing. I often run into an issue or two that forces me to switch the call to a different platform like Discord or Zoom to continue the screenshare. I think there‚Äôs 3 main improvements that could bring Signal‚Äôs screen sharing up to par with competitors.

1. Allow users to configure fps/resolution. This is a feature on other popular platforms like Discord. Sometimes Signal‚Äôs screenshare is literally unusable due to how bad the quality is, sometimes the resolution makes reading anything impossible, and sometimes the low fps makes watching anything impossible. Some users have reported increased quality through some hacks which the average user would not/could do. If the client can already change these parameters, then it should really be exposed to all users, not just the ones who compile Signal themselves.

2. Allow multiple users to share their screen at once. I‚Äôm not sure if this is a bug or if this just isn‚Äôt supported for some reason, but I was unable to share my screen while my friend was already sharing his screen. I tested again with my other friend and we still could not both share our screens. I don‚Äôt understand why we can both share our cameras but not our screens. This makes tech support very difficult as I was guiding my friend through a problem he was having, but I could not see his screen since only one of us could share it at a time. Because of this issue, we eventually hung up on Signal and called on Discord instead.

3. Allow audio in screen shares This is more of a quality of life feature, but it is really nice watching videos together with your friends through a screen share. Unfortunately Signal does not allow us to do this yet.

If I missed anything or got anything incorrect, please feel free to let me know. I think Signal‚Äôs screen sharing is so close to being amazing, but just needs these improvements to bring it up to speed with competitors.

Audio sharing
In parts the same as this request

Sound sharing during screen sharing

Maybe it is a bug, but I can‚Äôt share the audio during screen sharing. Desktop, flatpak version.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
Hi @pickle_umbrella ,
Please split your request to its components so people can support each. as mentioned, #3 was already requested.

posts.name: Pickle
posts.cooked: Hey, what do you mean by support each? I thought 1 post with 3 minor feature suggestions for screen sharing would be more appropriate than 3 small posts as I didn‚Äôt want it to look like I was spamming the forums.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: nice thought, but we actually prefer it separate so we can have clear discussions on each. it also makes it easier to catch duplicates, be it in this post (#3) or in future posts.

posts.name: Pickle
posts.cooked: Ah, okay I‚Äôll make sure to separate future posts then. Sorry about that.

posts.name: Mher Hovhannisyan
posts.cooked:
I maybe wrong. But back in day i could screen share at the same time as my friend sharing. I noticed that a few weeks ago, and don‚Äôt know is that really how I remember or no.

Also I saw one guy on reddit that said he rewrote some code (and also compiled everything again), and the screen share is now working how he want. But it‚Äôs too complicated.

I‚Äôm surprised that not that many people are talking about that screen share is laggy. I understand that it‚Äôs not meant to share screens, but it‚Äôs sad that I can‚Äôt use one platform for calls. (also I checked the code, resolution was set to max 640x480, and frame rate to min 1 max 30. I‚Äôm not a coder, so I can‚Äôt say 100% that it is like that)

posts.name: Lady Anna
posts.cooked: And make it at least 2.5K 60 FPS(With HDR1000 if possible) with around 44‚Äì50 MB of bitrate.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: i think setting a hard floor is a bad idea. the request here for several options is the way to go.

posts.name: Lady Anna
posts.cooked: I‚Äôm not saying the minimum has to be 2.5K, but something with at least reasonably good quality (since 1080p is falling out of use). There could also be a P2P version to avoid server costs.

Lady-Anna:

There could also be a P2P version to avoid server costs.

I‚Äôm pretty sure screen sharing (just like regular video and voice calls by default) is already P2P ‚Äì it only goes through the server if you use the ‚ÄúAlways relay calls‚Äù option.

posts.name: Mher Hovhannisyan
posts.cooked: for me, it would be good to be atleast 720p and 24fps. But I do like if I had an option to choose resolution/fps.

posts.name: Lily :3
posts.cooked:
While this might not be the most popular idea, since Signal implemented a monetization strategy for encrypted backups screenshare could be another area to do it - while also improving the experience for non-paying users in the process.

Having 720p/24 fps with audio for everyone, with a paid version that allows 1080p/30fps or more, would already be a great improvement for most users and could be a interesting source of revenue from more demanding users.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
sounds like this FR, which is indeed not very popular:

A Premium plan to rise up Signal funding Feature Requests

To generate more revenue and help Signal‚Äôs mission, we could imagine our own subscription model. Wht do you think? Any features ideas to suggest? [Capture d‚ÄôeÃÅcran 2023-11-20 aÃÄ 05.41.10]
